page.title: 05CUSTOMS
page.content: {An Easter Bonnet Competition}for ladies and children is held in Cragg Vale and a{Yard of Ale Comp.}is held for the men to see who can drink it in the shortest time.On{Gala Day}in Mill Bank a{Crowning of the Rose Queen} takes place.In nearby fields there are many different stalls and side shows in aid of various charities and brass bands.{A Rushbearing Ceremony}has been reintroduced since 1977 to commemorate the 1800's when church floors were restrewn with rushes.Today the rush- bearing cart loaded with rushes and adorned with silver and other decorations is paraded through the village of Mill Bank accompanied by teams of Morris Dancers,folk musicians and brass bands. The rushbearing men wear white shirts,black trousers, panama hats and clogs.
